args:
Lapis leaves a card with Bella's location written
on it and vanishes. With the matter settled,
the opera enters its grand finale. As Karina
successfully sings the princess's aria, Bella
watches from backstage, and a strange smile
creeps up upon her face.
Heh. Well done. But do you even really\nWANT to catch me?
Would things not be better for you\nif dear Bella never returned?
Why, if I return the songstress of flowers,\nyou will be forced to abandon the stage!
You sing beautifully; it would be a shame\nnot to share that gift with the world.
And all of that work you did to make the\nrole your own? All of that rehearsing?\nIt will now be for nothing.
Nice try, ye clever little bilge rat!\nBut nothing you say will make me\nabandon Bella to you.
Oh, what a shame! If only I could have\nseen you reach your full potential!
We've captured all the bandits at the\nHalidom, {player_name}, so...
Perfect timing, you two! Help us nab her!
Well, what do you know? You ARE!
＂No escape?＂ Do you understand\nto whom you are speaking?
I am the phantom thief, she who makes\nthe impossible possible!
Your Highness, look out!\nShe wields a manacaster!
Crap and keelhauls! She got away!
I wouldn't have thought a smokescreen \nwould be enough to slip away from THIS\nmany people, but clearly I was wrong.
That lady really DOES make the\nimpossible possible...
Uh, guys? Correct me if I'm wrong,\nbut is that a card with a blue rose on it?
＂As a reward for being so clever as to\n'capture' me, I've delivered the Noble\nFlower back to the Halidom.＂
Returning a person who was in our care\nin the first place is hardly a ＂reward!＂

＂And to my pirate queen, seeing as how I
went to all the trouble of coaching you up,
be a good girl and get back on that stage.
—The Phantom Thief Lapis＂
What is the meaning of this?!
I think maybe she's trying to cheer you on.
I don't need that from her!
...But I suppose it WOULD be good\nto finish my performance.
If what this card says is true, Bella is\nsomewhere in the Halidom. Let's find her!
BELLA! Oh, my sweet soprano!\nYou're back safe and sound!
I'm sorry to have worried everyone.
Before I even knew what happened,\nI found myself here in this bed.
All that matters is that you're safe.
I'm sorry we couldn't protect you.\nIt must have been a trying experience.
Not at all—I'm fine. But more importantly,\nwhat's happening with the opera?
The phantom thief said you were staging\nan opera to raise my ransom money?
Yeah, I had to sub in for you.\nAnd speaking of that...I have a request.
I wondered if it would be all right for me\nto stay on and sing the second act?
I know it's your role, so if you want it back\nI can't really complain, but...
But now that I've come this far, I really\nwant to finish my performance as my\nown kind of princess.
I understand. The stage is yours.\nI look forward to hearing you sing.
Thank you! I won't let you down!
(Okay, we're finally at the duel scene.\nThis is the one I was worried about.)
(My princess is going to step between\nher dueling lover and fiancé...and die)
(To tell the truth, I didn't understand her\nat first. Forbidden to love and then dying\nsenselessly over it? Pffft. Come on.)
(That's why I thought someone else would\nbe better suited for the role—and why I\nchose to run away.)
(But now, I can't bear the thought of\nsomeone else singing the part.)
(Only I can sing the song of a princess\nwho showed bravery in the end and ended\nher life on her own terms!)

Lapis leaves a card with Bella's location written
on it and vanishes. With the matter settled,
the opera enters its grand finale. As Karina
successfully sings the princess's aria, Bella
watches from backstage, and a strange smile
creeps up upon her face.
Well done, my pirate queen.\nWell done indeed.

For a truly transcendent performance,
one must make the role their own—
and you have crawled into the skin
of this princess for true.
Well then, the bandits threatening the\nopera have been taken care of.

Now nothing will get in the way of the
performances. I owe more to this opera
troupe than I can ever repay, so I'd best be
grateful to the prince and his people.
Congratulations on your performance,\nKarina! I was watching from the wings.
Regular old seat not your style, I guess?\nAnyway, um...what did you think?
Oh, you were simply magnificent!\nI've half a mind to scout you.
C'mon, don't tease! ...And anyway, it's\na pirate's life for me, yar har ho.
I do not tease, my dear. I truly think you\ncan make the impossible possible.
Ah, but you CAN do the impossible,\nmy pirate queen.
I cannot wait to have fun with you again\nsometime very soon... Oh ho ho!
